paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant H1153Y, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Died during a bicycle exercise in a fitness room
individual_records.evidence_sentence: the variant c.3457C > T (p.His1153Tyr) detected in a 20-year-old man who died during a bicycle exercise in a fitness room

functional_data.summary: The H1153Y-KCNH2 mutation causes a loss of HERG channel function through an alteration of channel biophysical properties that reduces the current density leading to LQT2.

variants.evidence_level: Functional studies provide evidence of pathogenicity.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was classified as a variant of unknown significance according to ACMG guidelines.
key_quotes: The H1153Y-KCNH2 variant was previously reported in LQTS patients by Napolitano et al. in 2005 and classified as class 3 (variants of unknown significance, VUS) according to ACMG guidelines.
These results provide the first functional evidence for H1153Y-KCNH2 mutation-induced abnormal channel properties.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the variant was clearly described in the text.
